content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-267-34-A |Item_parent=Disorders of acid-base equilibrium and hydro-electrolytic disorders |Item_parent_short=Disorders of acid-base balance and fluid and electrolyte disorders |Rank=A |Title=Know when to prescribe blood calcium levels and define hypocalcaemia. |Description=Threshold, interpretation according to albumin level, ionised calcaemia |Rubric=Definition |Contributors=P Rieu; B Moulin; M Flamant |Order=34}} *Definitions **Total hypocalcaemia is defined as a plasma concentration of less than 2.20 mmol/L, and ionised hypocalcaemia as a concentration of less than 1.15 mmol/L. ** *Calcemia measurement to look for hypocalcemia when : **symptoms suggestive of hypocalcaemia (neuromuscular disorders, cardiac disorders) **pathology at risk of hypocalcaemia (chronic renal failure, history of parathyroid surgery).

properties.question: What is the correct threshold for defining hypocalcaemia?
